intro: Dryandra pteridifolia, commonly known as the fern-leaved dryandra, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to Western Australia and is characterized by its distinctive fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, pale yellow flowers that appear in late winter to early spring. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in sandy or rocky habitats. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
